Package sait.bms.managers

Class BookManagementSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • sait.bms.managers.BookManagementSystem
  • public class BookManagementSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    The ABC Book Company wants to implement a system to manage their books more efficiently. The system should allow both employees and patrons to checkout, find, and list books. Book Management System.
    Version:
    Feburary 14, 2020
    Author:
    Jonghyun Park

    • Field Summary

      (package private) static java.util.ArrayList<Book> books  
      (package private) static java.lang.String filepath  
      (package private) static java.util.Scanner in

      BookManagementSystem()  

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void checkOut()
      Allows a patron to checkout a book using its ISBN.
      static void displayMenu()
      Display Menu for Book Management System.
      static void findBooks()
      Allows a patron to enter a search term and the program will display a list of books that have a title matching the search term.Implement a method that prompts the user patron to enter a title, performs a case-insensitive search of books that containing the inputed title, and displays them.
      static void loadBooks()
      A data file containing a sample list of books is provided.
      static void randomBooks()
      Allows a patron to print a list of random books.
      static void saveBooks()
      Implement and call a method, when the program exits, that takes the books stored in the array list and persists them back to the “books.txt” file in the proper format.
      static void typeBooks()
      Allows a patron to view a list of books with a specific type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BookManagementSystem

        public BookManagementSystem()

    • Method Detail

      • displayMenu

        public static void displayMenu()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Display Menu for Book Management System.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file could not be accessed.

      • checkOut

        public static void checkOut()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Allows a patron to checkout a book using its ISBN. If the book is unavailable, the user will be informed and the program will return back to the main menu. Otherwise, if the book is available, the available count will be decremented and the book information will be displayed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file could not be accessed.

      • findBooks

        public static void findBooks()
        Allows a patron to enter a search term and the program will display a list of books that have a title matching the search term.Implement a method that prompts the user patron to enter a title, performs a case-insensitive search of books that containing the inputed title, and displays them.

      • typeBooks

        public static void typeBooks()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Allows a patron to view a list of books with a specific type. The user will also enter a format, diet, genre, or frequency (depending on the type of book) and the book list will be narrowed down further.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file could not be accessed.

      • randomBooks

        public static void randomBooks()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Allows a patron to print a list of random books. The list of books can contain any type of book.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file could not be accessed.

      • saveBooks

        public static void saveBooks()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Implement and call a method, when the program exits, that takes the books stored in the array list and persists them back to the “books.txt” file in the proper format.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file could not be accessed.

      • loadBooks

        public static void loadBooks()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        A data file containing a sample list of books is provided. The data file contains a combination of four different types of books: children’s books, cookbooks, paperbacks, and periodicals.Each book is uniquely identified using an ISBN and the information for each type of book is described in the formatting section.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when the file could not be accessed.
